action.action-desc: Mr. Kean of New Jersey introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To establish a multiagency Middle School Mental Health Task Force at the Department of Education and the Department of Health and Human Services.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Health Minds for a Better Future Act.

section.header: Middle School Mental Health Task Force

subsection.text: There is established a multiagency Middle School Mental Health Task Force (referred to in this section as the Task Force) at the Department of Education and the Department of Health and Human Services to study and survey the resources that are available to parents and educators to identify and help middle-school aged students that may be experiencing mental health issues.

paragraph.text: The Task Force established under subsection (a) shall consist of 12 members including—

subparagraph.text: the Secretary of Health and Human Services;
a representative of an association of school administration relating to middle school or high schools appointed by the Secretary of Education;
a representative of an association working for childhood mental health appointed by the Secretary of Education;
one school counselor or educator from each United States region, including—

clause.text: the Northeastern region (consisting of Maine, New Hampshire, Vermont, New York, Massachusetts, Rhode Island, Connecticut, Pennsylvania, and New Jersey);
the Midwestern region (consisting of Ohio, Michigan, Indiana, Illinois, Missouri, Kansas, Nebraska, South Dakota, North Dakota, Minnesota, Wisconsin, and Iowa);
the Western region (consisting of Montana, Washington, Oregon, California, Arizona, New Mexico, Colorado, Utah, Nevada, Wyoming, Idaho, Alaska, and Hawaii); and

the Southern region (consisting of Texas, Oklahoma, Arkansas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia, Florida, South Carolina, North Carolina, Tennessee, Kentucky, West Virginia, Maryland, Delaware, and Virginia); and

subparagraph.text: one parent of a middle school student (from a public or private secondary school) from each region listed in subparagraphs (A) through (D) of paragraph (6).

paragraph.text: Each member of the Task Force described in subparagraphs (E) and (F) of paragraph (1) shall be selected through an annual application process determined by the Secretary of Education.
Each member of the Task Force shall serve on the Task Force without pay.
Each member of the Task Force shall serve on the Task Force for 2 calendar years.

subsection.text: The Chairperson of the Task Force shall be elected by a majority vote of the members of the Commission. The term of office of the Chairperson may not exceed 2 years.

paragraph.text: The Task Force shall meet twice a year at the call of the Chairperson or the majority of the members of the Task Force.
Three-fourths of the members of the Task Force shall constitute a quorum but a lesser number may hold hearings.

subsection.text: The Task Force shall not be entitled to appoint additional personnel.
The Task Force may not issue subpoenas.

The Task Force may procure temporary and intermittent services under section 3109(b) of title 5, United States Code, but at rates for individuals not to exceed the annual rate of basic pay for GS–10 of the General Schedule.

To the extent or in the amounts provided in advance in appropriation Acts, the Task Force may contract with and compensate government and private agencies or persons for certain services relating to the work of the Task Force.

subsection.text: In this Act, the terms middle grades and secondary school have the meanings given the terms in section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801).
